website_summaries.verdict: Besides being hands-free, this reservoir is also virtually taste-free, which is a plus if you are sensitive to chemical aftertastes.
pros: Embedded silver ion protects bottle from mold and bacteria
Hydration hose with hyperflow bite valve
Tube is easy to route through openings
cons: Reservoir fills from the bottom, so you must take it out to fill, and it can leak into the backpack

customer_reviews.title: Great for a recovering patient
customer_reviews.text: We used this for my husband when he was moved from ICU and too weak to lift a cup. We simply hung it from his IV pole and laid the mouthpiece by his head. He was able to take a sip in the middle of the night without having to call for help. It was a huge relief to him.
customer_reviews.author: Pak

customer_reviews.title: Reliable but hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this on several hikes, including a week-long trip to Banff, Canada last year. It’s held up fantastically! It does take a bit to get used to “biting” the spout to get the water out, but it’s easy once you get the hang of it. The pouch has never leaked and it fits well in my 26L bag. My biggest complaint is the small water opening, which is no larger than a normal 16.9oz water bottle. This makes it very difficult to clean! I have to hang it somewhere for a day to let it dry. The small opening also makes it difficult to add ice.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: love the size but tiny "fill" opening
customer_reviews.text: I brought this along for backpacking/camping/thruhiking because of its massive size and due to the fact that it adapts very nicely to the Sawyer line of water filtration products. My only gripe is the tiny "fill" opening. It worked fine with flowing rivers/streams in the Tahoe area, but if you're expecting this to fill up in still water, you're better off using a "Smart Water" bottle (youtube it) or something like that....
customer_reviews.author: michael l.

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking!
customer_reviews.text: This is great for hiking, even on really long hikes. Usually, I'll fill it up halfway to two thirds of the way and be all set for a day hike. You can just put it into the laptop pocket of your backpack (upside down, so that the water can come out- this took a while for me to realize). There was a bit of a plastic-y taste the first time I filled it up, but it's very quickly going away and doesn't bother me.
customer_reviews.author: Zeke

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Used this pouch to replace the one that came in the Teton hydration pack I purchased. I found the platypus to be easier to fill and maneuver overall, but just a little harder to clean and dry. Also, I'm not a big fan of the valve as it seems to require a very precise bite to open. Gonna look into possibly changing it. Otherwise, kept my water cool for a few hours of MTBing and I would still recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier S.Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Quality of small parts
customer_reviews.text: Starting from packaging to no plastic smell, excellent quality of all the little details such as valve and bladder itself. It looks like it won’t leak. Excellent product! It’s my 3rd bladder after 2 leaking Chinese ones and I’ll stick with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: That’s some high quality H2O (holder).
customer_reviews.text: This water bladder holds a great amount of water. Love the design and the Moseley to it. Only downside is it’s hard to dry out once you’re done. I guess that’s why they make the additional cleaning accessory.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H.

customer_reviews.title: Everything else is fine, but after one use, the plastic loop tab broke.
customer_reviews.text: I had taken this reservoir on one camping trip, and it was fine. The water flow is fine and filling and using it was fine, save for the bit of plastic taste the water had. I've come back from the camping trip, rinsed the bag, and filled it with water to use while I was working at my desk. I picked it up by the loop at the top to hang on a hook by my desk for better flow - with about 1.5 liters of water in the bag - and the plastic hang loop broke!
customer_reviews.author: Jasper

customer_reviews.title: good buy
customer_reviews.text: been using Platypus since they first hit the market. Allot of improvements have been made since then. welds on the seams are much better and material seems to be a little thicker. So I have not had one go bad since years ago. I do allot of back packing and it my preferred hydration system for that. I also have a smaller one I use on moutainbiking and have extra bags to hold water on long hikes with no water on route.
customer_reviews.author: Ward3

customer_reviews.title: Just used this as a 1 liter easily fillable external hydration system on a long backpack trip
customer_reviews.text: Just used this as a 1 liter easily fillable external hydration system on a long backpack trip. Having it positioned on the outside of the pack makes it easy to see when it needs to be filled and to easily fill it without getting inside the pack. Since there was lots of water on the trail I was able to carry less water (less weight) and just fill up as needed. I loved this way of carrying and drinking water in this situation. Much easier than trying to reach around a grab a 1 liter water bottle out of the side pouch. My arms just can't do that!
customer_reviews.author: Reno shopper

customer_reviews.title: Bare bones, not worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculously overpriced for what you get. It’s a bag with a hose attached. That’s it. No mouthpiece cover, no clip, absolutely nothing to justify the high price. I paid less for a larger off brand hydration pack that has a better closure, a nice mouthpiece cover, insulation for the tube, and more features. I don’t know why anyone would waste their money on this incredibly bare bones one.
customer_reviews.author: Serious About Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: This water bladder is excellent quality. Very durable and easy to use. I got to put in my backpacking pack and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Smith

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product: Lightweight, Minimalist, Modular, Cheap, and reasonably durable
customer_reviews.text: I have a few hydration packs, but I bought this one because I needed to carry a lot of water for a few desert trips. This, coupled with a few 2.5L Platypus Platy bottles, is the best hydration pack system I have used so far. When I have exhausted one bladder, I can just screw the drinking hose onto the next one. Alternatively, if I am only going on a day hike, I can also opt to bring only a single, smaller platy bottle attached to the drinking hose. The setup is minimalist, lightweight, and modular. Additionally, the location of the filling/dispensing hole means that this system is easier to fill/dry compared to more expensive CamelBak systems.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Survived El Capitan
customer_reviews.text: Tested in Yosemite for a week. Held up well even when accidentally scuffed on the side of El Capitan. Did not burst, and holds a decent amount of water for a day trip. No leaks or accompanying embarrassing wet rear end while climbing. Not sure how to sanitize this, though, apart from a 1 part bleach to 3 parts water flush, and then multiple water flushes afterwards. Hanging it to dry seems like it would invite mold, so I just keep it full all the time. It's not like I don't need to drink water all day anyway. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Practical, and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for several seasons now and it is holding up more than its share of its duties. I've taken it everywhere from thru hiking to biking across town. I was initial worried about the circumstance that it popped a leak, but seasons later it is still holding through as tough as ever! Even when my extremely heaving backpack gets dropped, unphased! Great design for the valve to, just bite and go!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love these Platypus bladders. They don't make the water tasty plasticy (sp) and seem to seal tightly. I keep one full next to my bed so if I get thirsty at night I can get a sip and stay hydrated. With 2 Liters, I can go a week or two without having to refill. Awesome. They're also great for tucking into my backpack for hydrating on the move. These are better than hard or steel bottles because they don't dent or get damaged from falls. Try one.
customer_reviews.author: Greg M.

customer_reviews.title: Plastic taste but still convenient
customer_reviews.text: Took it for a 3 day camping trip, it did not leak at all. I had it with the rest of my clothes on my backpack and it was just fine. There is definitely a plastic taste to the water but I dont mind it that much. It can be a little hard to position it properly on the backpack but still a good purchase
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo R

customer_reviews.title: Wish it came with a toggle nozzle
customer_reviews.text: Great bladder, easy to clean (hose attaches to the bottom of the bladder), but it only came with a bite valve. Not a fan of bite valves so I had to order a toggle valve (not sure what they're actually called) myself.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Easy and lightweight for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: I used this through my multi day hike and I found it worked out great. I didn't find the clip super useful and ended up wrapping it around my chest strap. However, a few times the straw wasn't working and I had to rotate the straw around to get the flow back which required me to remove my bag and several items to access it. Otherwise is was easy to use for water refills and hooked up great with the Sawyer Squeeze, CNOC bladder and Sawyer blue coupling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High value hydration bladder
customer_reviews.text: Love this water bladder. Hangs perfectly in my deuter speedlite 20 day pack. New out of the box, the water tasted fine. No chemical taste. After using, i wash it out and throw it in the freezer until the next time i use it. The only thing that would make this better is if it came with a cover for the drinking spout. Sometimes that part hits the ground and gets dirty or it sometimes drips a little after taking a drink. The separate cover you can buy is hard to attach and when i do, it feels like the spout is going to off.
customer_reviews.author: Randoh

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Works well. No leaks.
customer_reviews.text: This is light weight and works well. I use this for cycling and hiking and it’s simply great. My little one even loves using it. This is very easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: LID0409

customer_reviews.title: Durable. Reliable. Sexy.
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving it five stars because it does it’s job as advertised. It is highly durable and you do not ever have to worry about leaks or breaking the bag unless of course you run over it with your car. I wish it had a handle on the end where the mouth is, and the mouth is small so filling can be clumsy if you’re in the bush. I did not dock a star for things like that though because I was aware of them before I purchased it. Other than those two items it is a five star product.
customer_reviews.author: JustinC

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I switched from a camelback bladder and wonder why it took me so long to do so! I LOVE my platypus bladder! It drinks smoothly and, while i haven’t had to use a cleaning brush with it yet, it seems very easy to care for. I’m looking forward to taking it on more trips, soon!
customer_reviews.author: Ana D.

customer_reviews.title: no plastic taste and a simple effective design
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I noticed was the absolute lack of plastic taste, that was great. The water blatter has plenty of pressure and easy to drink out of. I also like the notch that allows you too hang the bladder to dry out. I really liked this product and would recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: 3tomr

customer_reviews.title: Great for rough use
customer_reviews.text: I've used only Osprey and Camelbak water bladders in the past but decided to try out Platypus as I needed a larger bladder for longer hiking trips. This thing is super easy to fill up, super easy to clean, and it doesn't leak! I also throw it in my pack with tons of gear and it hasn't popped or torn. The system is super simple with minimal valves which makes it so easy to take apart and clean. And from the very first use there was no plastic taste. I'm very happy with this bladder and will order more from this brand in the future!
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Fits inside Blackburn outpost traingle frame bicycle bag medium
customer_reviews.text: Got this so it will fit inside my Blackburn outpost triangle bag (medium). The bladder itself was easy to clean and no taste when first used. Just warm water with soap. For those looking to find a way to get rid of a backpack style hydration system while riding your bicycle Blackburn outpost + platypus hoser fits the bill. The 2 liter bladder fits in the upper part pre extended just fine with room in the bottom extended part for roadside tools, tube, 2 co2 cartridges, co2 inflator, multitool barely takes up 1/3 of the bottom space.
customer_reviews.author: GF

customer_reviews.title: Awesome hydration bladder
customer_reviews.text: Awesome hydration bladder. Had a camelbak before and the quick release hose connection began to leak and disconnect after a year. The way this one is designed though, I never see that being a problem. Its gets a tight seal around the hose and I never have to worry about it. Also, the material of the bladder itself is very good and can be propped up even when empty, which makes it easy to fill from a pitcher or filter etc.
customer_reviews.author: Meghana Raja

customer_reviews.title: Great durability with hard use
customer_reviews.text: I've had 2 of these Platypus 3L bladders for 3 years now. In that time they have gotten over a 100 days on the trail and I'm pretty tough on equipment. I use them with a sawyer mini inline gravity filter and I have had ZERO problems. One is my dirty bag and the other my clean bag so they always get used simultaneously. Only downside can be that it's hard to get more than 2.5-2.75 liters in the bag. Its just a design issue. Otherwise, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Scheckell

customer_reviews.title: and that the platypus design is never easy to drink from
customer_reviews.text: I'm halfway between 3 and 4 stars on this one. I owned also a big zip 3L. This thing's problem is more difficult to fill from small sinks in hotels, and that the platypus design is never easy to drink from. You have to bite just at the right location to allow water flow, and not too hard either. Do yourself a favor and get a big zip instead if you frequently fill water pouches in hotels before hiking. In the outdoors using streams I guess won't make too much difference.
customer_reviews.author: Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it, you'll be happy you did!
customer_reviews.text: I've used alot of bladders over the years. At first I was worried about the ruggedness. But I've carried these for the last five years and love them. Easy to fill with a pump or dipping, super easy to pour out of. The "other" bladders with the huge openings are a mess to pour from to fill pots or other containers.
customer_reviews.author: Curt Mayberry

customer_reviews.title: nice, greatly made on the seals. Suction could use a bit adjusted
customer_reviews.text: The flow can be a bit hard at times when you're towards the bottom. Bottom as in 1/4 full, so not empty. It drips which got my backpack soaked at night, but I know I can clip it and leave it upright in the future. However, that sucked for a learning experience because the backpack was soaked and so was my sleeping bag which is a 800 fill down. They need to fix this with a cap built in...... No leakage in my stuffed 50lb bag. Clothes, Tent, food, Jetboil etc etc and worked perfectly for the most part
customer_reviews.author: aimology

customer_reviews.title: Fits inside Chrome Kadet
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! And it fits perfectly inside a Chrome Kadet bag! So easy to carry this way and will be great while cycling.
customer_reviews.author: BassMint

customer_reviews.title: Simple, just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I love that this is easy to fill and close. I got sick of struggling with the big round things that were so hard to thread. This is as simple as filling and closing a water bottle. Holds just the right amount for most of my day hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Bibliotecaria

customer_reviews.title: Great system
customer_reviews.text: I got this for hiking rim to rim of the grand canyon. Worked great and stayed hydrated the whole day! Costs a bit more, but if you'll use it alot it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonny Nielson

customer_reviews.title: This is the best hydration system.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best hydration systeme IMO and I've tried most of them. They don't leave a bad taste like camelbacks and cascade designs stands by them 100%. I have had 2 platypi replaced for free. Why a five star review for something that has failed you say? Well all products eventually fail and I got a lot of use from them before they did. In the last two cases I noticed that 1 or 2 of the 3 layers of plastic had developed holes in an area that had a constant kink near the plastic hose attachment so they didn't leak in service. Cascade designs replaced them before they actually got a hole in them.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: This is a very basic water bladder.
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Works fine. No taste in my water. Size of 1 liter - which was hard to find. Does not leak. Price is fair. Con: Bag does not open from the top. There's only a small hole at the bottom where the hose screws in. This makes it difficult to dry, clean, and refill. Bite valve is difficult to drink from. Water is very hard to get out of the bite valve. At times I have to stop my run and really work on the valve to get water out without getting winded or choking. I bought two and the issue seems to be the bite valve design.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Nurmikko

customer_reviews.title: Well Made - Great For Use With a Filter
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses this in harmony with awhen he takes my son camping so they can gather and have clean water whenever they need it. They've probably been out at least a dozen times since I bought it for them and it seems to be holding be very well.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon & Cacia

customer_reviews.title: Will buy in the future again if needed
customer_reviews.text: Love this product so far. No leaks and seems very strong. Works great, great suction
customer_reviews.author: william s, yohn

customer_reviews.title: Hoser Performs on AZ Elk Hunt!
customer_reviews.text: Took the Platypus 2L on a 5 day elk hunt in N. AZ. Was in the low 60s despite being mid Nov and was sunny the entire time so went through a lot of water with backpack hunting. Really liked how fast the water flows through the Hose and bite valve. Kept the bladder in the big zipper pocket in my pack. When I put my pack down the bite valve would sometimes hit the dirt (my fault) and surprisingly was easy to clean off. All in all happy with the purchase and happy how it performed in the field.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan D

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It works, holds water, has a long hose and a mouth piece. I have to admit, though, I don't care for these and prefer just a plain old water bottle. One reason is all this water that you really can't share (I suppose it depends on who you are with). It's a pain to take it out of the backpack, fill it up, then work it back into the backpack and route the hose. Cleaning is a real chore. I don't need a drink every 5 minutes so a water bottle within a decent reach is easy for me.
customer_reviews.author: Steve and Amy

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Only use it for water and it never needs to be cleaned O.O
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get one for your health
customer_reviews.text: awesome stink free bladder, need I say more? Have you tried that other brand that comes with nearly all mountain bike packs? Yikes whata smell. This one is great, no smell, no problem. I feel better about this in terms of my own health as I am concerned about all those plastic products leaving residues in your drinking water. ALWAYS refill your bladder with fresh water before every ride and rise it first. You want to old water that has been in contact with the plastic out of your bladder because it probably has leached
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Water Bladder
customer_reviews.text: I go backpacking frequently and needed a reliable water bladder. I have herd other backpackers talk about Platypus and had to try one my self. Upon getting it I had a trip to go on for 14 days. It was very reliable and I would recommend it to anyone. The only downside is it's small filling hole, but that is only a small problem.
customer_reviews.author: Your average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Best. Hydration. System.
customer_reviews.text: None of that nasty Camelbak flavor from the rubber. Easier to fill with attachments. Connects with the gravity filter by Platypus.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey C

customer_reviews.title: Functional but not Ideal
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Platypus Hoser as an "emergency" replacement; I was running a trail marathon in Virginia but had left my normal bladder at home in Georgia. I ordered this item late Wednesday afternoon and it was delivered Friday morning, so kudos on the shipping. This is a fine bladder for the price, but the narrow fill opening makes it difficult to add ice, fill from another bottle, or fill from streams or other water sources. Also the bite valve is a little touchy in that you have to bite it just right to get a good flow.
customer_reviews.author: Jay B

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Wore it on a 9 mile hike and it worked fine. Ty
customer_reviews.author: tabitha

customer_reviews.title: Only hydration system I use!
customer_reviews.text: I use a hydration system daily for work and I have always used Platypus! I love this water bladder and am on my second one. My first one worked perfectly for 5 years before my naughty dog decided to use it as a chew toy and I bought the exact same one to replace it since the Platypus has served me so well for many years. There is no gross rubber taste to this water bladder.
customer_reviews.author: Lori G.

customer_reviews.title: great for hiking with dogs
customer_reviews.text: Love Platypus products I highly recommend it because its so great not having to stop to pull out a bottle of water on hikes. It's great for when you have a dog too because you can keep your hands free and also fill up their bowls quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Chika

customer_reviews.title: Water smells like plastic after only 24hrs
customer_reviews.text: Water smells like plastic after only 24hrs. I bought two of these, one for use and one as backup water storage. After a day of storing water, it smelled like plastic. The smell was strong and was worse than the water stored in disposable bottles for a few days. For the money, I had expected better than that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking/ Mountain Biking!
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastic for hiking and mountain biking. Durable and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin O'Reilly

customer_reviews.title: NICE, but get the bite valve cover!
customer_reviews.text: Good for backpacking treks, etc. Difficult to clean unfortunately. Didn't come with the bite valve cover so we had to hunt one of those down. Trust me you want the bite valve cover so you don't eat dirt when grabbing a drink. It's lightweight which is better than large hard plastic bottles. Someone told me these fail and will cause a flood in your backpack-but my 16 year old took it for a 14 day backpacking trek and had no problems whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Best Companion on Hikes!
customer_reviews.text: Have owned it for a year and So far no complaint! I have carried it in 4 Fourteener hikes so far, and have encountered no problem (leakages or anything like that). Except for one time, when I went on fourteener hiking in snow last winter; and the water in the pipe was frozen for first 2 hours; but then it was okay. So my best buddy on hikes and long drives.
customer_reviews.author: SSS

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: This is practically impossible to air out after cleaning. I’m not willing to buy more gear (a hanger set up) just to clean it. Skip it and get the zipper bag.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a long hike!
customer_reviews.text: This was great! I ordered two and they are super easy to fill and pack in a sling backpack. Mine definitely had a plastic after taste/scent when I swallowed my water, which probably bothers some people but I don't mind it. I hope it will go away with time, but it might be mine specifically because my boyfriend's did not have the same strong scent.
customer_reviews.author: SoyCandice

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a while and I really like it. Whether I'm just going to the park with my wife and dog for a walk or to play frisbee, or if I'm hiking/backpacking, it's great to have a 3L bag. 3L can get pretty heavy, sometimes only add 1-2L, but I do like to hike sometimes and it's good to have a large amount of water. The mouthpiece seems to work well, the hose is fine, and the filler hole works well enough that I am sure I can use my backpacking filter to fill it no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Bag came with small holes in it and leaked on ...
customer_reviews.text: Bag came with small holes in it and leaked on first use. By the time I used it, it was past the return policy.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: The hanging hook is extremely useful if you ever need to hang this bladder (for ...
customer_reviews.text: Stupidly simple bladder that never fails. The material is insanely durable and keeps weight down due to its simplicity. The hanging hook is extremely useful if you ever need to hang this bladder (for storage, pouring water, filtering etc). The alligator clip is cheap and usually breaks but thats splitting hairs. I've added insulated tube covers for when its cold outside to keep the lines from freezing. The only other problem is cleaning it out to the point of being dry inside can be really tricky as the only opening is the size of a soda bottle.
customer_reviews.author: D. Adame

customer_reviews.title: They are easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Platypus and probably won't be my last. They are easy to clean, don't get slimy or stinky, function well, and have never leaked for me. The drinking spigots with the nozzle you can flip are cool, but I've seen them leak or flip on when setting down a pack so often, I prefer the kind that comes with this bladder. Can't beat the price either for the size!
customer_reviews.author: Cooper

customer_reviews.title: The hose stopped working all of a sudden. I ...
customer_reviews.text: The hose stopped working all of a sudden. I can’t fogure out why. I only used it a couple of times.
customer_reviews.author: Alice McMalice

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Really beginning to like platypus products, yes you can get cheaper but these are super handy, duarable, and packable
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Lyga

customer_reviews.title: Good, but has some flaws.
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to water bladders, this one does the job. It's well priced for what you get. That being said, it's worth spending a bit more for a bladder with a larger opening for filling and cleaning. The filler is small and narrow, making it harder and longer to dry. It also makes it harder to clean as mentioned. This is not to say that you can't do either, but it's more convenient with a larger opening.
customer_reviews.author: ArnellTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Hydration System
customer_reviews.text: Ever look down at your backpack strap and wish you could clip a water hose for easy access? This is the one, it’s perfect for jogs, short hikes, etc
customer_reviews.author: Max K Delbrück

customer_reviews.title: and it's nice and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: This is a durable bladder, and it's nice and inexpensive. However, the little mouthpiece comes out when you try to drink from it, which is not ideal when your fingers are all gross from hiking. Also, I should have researched beforehand, because I wanted to attach my mini Sawyer filter, but it's compatible with Camelbaks. For the Platypus, you have to cut the tubing. But that's my own fault, the three stars is for the irritating bite valve.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaks, no lapel clip
customer_reviews.text: I grew up with Platypus, but the fast flow hoses leak horribly, and no lapel clip!? C'mon guys, you were better than this. Thanks for selling those lapel clips separately for $10, I'm sure they cost 10 cents to manufacture
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: don't buy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: this is the most overpriced piece of junk you can ever get from a brand name..
customer_reviews.author: Murad Afandiyev

customer_reviews.title: ... use this in my hunting pack and it works great. I have never had a leak and it ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my hunting pack and it works great. I have never had a leak and it continues to hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Brock

customer_reviews.title: Platypus reservoirs are outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: Used this with my Camelbak pack and it fit perfectly and didn't leak at all on a short, 10 mile hike in the Gunks. I rinsed it well before using and there was no chemical taste. I also own a wide mouth 3 liter Platypus reservoir for my larger Osprey pack, and it has performed flawlessly on 23 Adirondack high peak hikes this past summer. These are very durable, functional reservoirs that are easy to drink from.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Opening placement allows for more water capacity, but a pain to refill.
customer_reviews.text: I first received a defective item, but returned it and it was replaced in a very timely manner. It works and carries water, a lot more than other water bladders, but the placement of the opening is a bit of a pain. You have to take it completely out of your backpack to refill which means it's a pain in the butt to push it back into a fully packed pack- thus the 4 stars. Still works though!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do you own The Platypus Kayak Hydrator?  You're In Luck!!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this 1.8L for over a year of hard use and NO leaks. If you own the Platypus Kayak Hydrator this is a perfect replacement for the plastic reservoir...the 1.8L fits like a glove and is the same measurement as the original! It's very reliable since in a kayak I place it where I can't reach it except just for the tube. I'm thrilled to have found this and that I can keep my Platypus Kayak Hydrator...it's the ONLY thing that would fit like the discontinued original.
customer_reviews.author: D. O'Connell

customer_reviews.title: Great for multi use camping and hiking
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I own a platypus antidote also. Comparatively the platypus is better suited for just a hydration pack due to the filling cap and no screw off hose. The platypus is much better suited for a dual purpose. It has a screw off hose for easy use for camp water. Also it works great in a pack. The only issue with it is it have a small fill hole. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: mudminnow180

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect in my PFD hydration sleeve
customer_reviews.text: Used as replacement bladder for my Astral PFD since they stopped producing their own, and so did NRS. Only thing on the market I could find that fit the bill and it worked perfectly. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Josh O.

customer_reviews.title: It's a great size though
customer_reviews.text: Having trouble getting rid of the plastic taste even after using it many times. It's a great size though, easy to clean, and I love the size of the mouth piece.
customer_reviews.author: alexiam90@knights.ucf.edu

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I use this 2-3 times/week. Doesn't leak at all, which beats my Camelback. I like the design and ease of use. I would absolutely recommend this. Of course I rinsed it out before use. But, nonetheless, there was no taste - at all. With other hydration bladders, I sometimes get a disgusting initial taste.
customer_reviews.author: Carissa F

customer_reviews.title: Decent Hydration System
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and compact. Mine leaked from the hose unless held upright, with a little work I have solved it
customer_reviews.author: BW SL NA 007

customer_reviews.title: Bladders all the way. Who the heck uses an actual bottle anymore?
customer_reviews.text: Bladders all the way. Who the heck uses an actual bottle anymore? Bottles are so bulky, heavy, and you have to actually hold them and tip them to even get a drink! Take a step out of the dark ages and into the modern times with a water bladder. And take a step out of stupidity and don't pay that ridiculous price for the Camelback. Platypus is stronger and less expensive. Now you're smarter and more modern!
customer_reviews.author: Israelius

customer_reviews.title: like in my backpack
customer_reviews.text: I have used Platypus Hosers for my hiking hydration for about 20 years. My originals became brittle and started leaking only when pressure applied, like in my backpack :( so I replaced my two liter sized bags with one 2 liter. This seems to be of a better quality material and I hope to have it another 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: Nettz

customer_reviews.title: 3 liters is a great size. Tastes great.
customer_reviews.text: Hasnt let me down yet. Leaks at the mouth piece very slightly. After i drink it i try to blow some air back in or pinch open with fingers to allow air in. And dont let the mouth piece dangle pointing toward ground. Might leak. Im suprised i havent burst it yet. Must be decent plastic. Im sure ill burst it though. Im not very nice to it.
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: Quality liquid storage device.  Great for backpacking or races!
customer_reviews.text: The platypus is an awesome liquid storage device. We used it while backpacking through Europe (we went to over 21 countries)! The bag really does hold about 1.8 liters of water. It did not leak during our usage. It folds up very nicely into a small space, which is awesome if you are tight on space to begin with. My biggest complaint is that it made all of our water taste ALOT like plastic during the first few uses. You really need to put this thing through a dishwasher or take it through a vigorous cleaning. Once it's clean though you shouldn't have any issues!
customer_reviews.author: oJeffMo

customer_reviews.title: Great hydration system
customer_reviews.text: It is great, I use it for hiking and climbing. Much better than any other system, does not smell and is easy to clean with the set of brushes sold.
customer_reviews.author: Fufu berry

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: I used all fall hunting the back country. Very good product. Durable.
customer_reviews.author: jk kinsey

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Fits great in my backpack. worked very well for travel. I bought two
customer_reviews.author: Clairissa west

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is the hole where you pour the water is a bit small. Makes it difficult if you want to use any kind of powder mix. Other than that this seems like a sound product!
customer_reviews.author: MariaAAiraM

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Only wish is that the hose was insulated to prevent heating of the water that remains in the hose during use. Otherwise, stores a lot of water and does exactly what it's supposed to. One other downside is that it's a little difficult to fill from a natural spring because the opening is only about an inch in diameter. If that's not a concern then this is a great buy. Only use purified water though because other liquids could compromise the integrity of the vessel.
customer_reviews.author: Nick H.

customer_reviews.title: I have been using them for twenty years and I ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using them for twenty years and I just threw away my first one. This one was given to my nephew as a gift where we are in scouts together. I didn't even have to think about it.
customer_reviews.author: steven s. from Ashland, KY

customer_reviews.title: Clip and bite valve are not that good. If you bite too hard
customer_reviews.text: Clip and bite valve are not that good. If you bite too hard, the water flow stops, unintuituvely. Fortunately, CamelBak valves are compatible with the tube. The clip keeper for the tube is light, simple, and durable, but not suitable for removing and attaching repeatedly on the go like the magnet systems other drydration packs have.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great Bladder for Playpus or Camelbak backpacks.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality with this bag. I bought it to replace my Camelbak bladder and I really like the design of the Platypus. I doubt I will go back to Camelbak bladders in the future. This bag is wonderfully made and easier to fill up.
customer_reviews.author: Whit Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. There are not too many 1 litter ones out there that would fit well in my hydration backpack. This is not fancy by any means but it does the job that I need.
customer_reviews.author: Twins Rock

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: easy to clean & dry, and so far no slimy residue even when water is left in there for a couple of days
customer_reviews.author: Britta Burton

customer_reviews.title: Hot flash helper.
customer_reviews.text: I don't use my Platypus to drink from, I use it for hot flashes. There is nothing decent on the market that addresses comfort for perimenopausal and menopausal women. I took my Platypus, filled it with water, wrapped a thin towel around it. It became the only pillow I use now. The Platypus is made of really strong plastic so I expect it to last a long time. How much heat gets wicked away depends completely on how much I wrap it and whether I refrigerate it. It's really been a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Ronda Bandy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product Durable Works exactly how you want a bladder system to work. Couldn’t backpack without it!
customer_reviews.author: Tami Runyon

customer_reviews.title: Great hiker addition
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the few extra dollars over other products that are good, but this is solid a,d dependable.
customer_reviews.author: AvidReader

customer_reviews.title: It retrofitted nicely with my Sawyer Squeeze
customer_reviews.text: Zero spill when filling as long as you have a concentrated filling stream. It retrofitted nicely with my Sawyer Squeeze. Seems very durable. The only downside is that it is a pain in the ass to clean; like most bladders. I wish it was a little more flat (it has a fairly large circumference).
customer_reviews.author: DannyC

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise a great product. Lightest 2L hydration system I've come across
customer_reviews.text: A little awkward to fill at home, due to the opening being at an angle. Otherwise a great product. Lightest 2L hydration system I've come across. I use it with the Sawyer Fast Fill Kit so I don't have to go dig it out of my pack to refill with filtered water.
customer_reviews.author: MN

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite water bladders for the price
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite water bladders for the price. Hasn't popped after 10 GoRuck events which just punish any outdoor equipment. my only one big complaint is I wish it had a refill outlet at the top like a lot of camelbaks to make refilling much easier. The mouth peice can also be prone to popping off if used in a very rough environment
customer_reviews.author: david sharpensteen

customer_reviews.title: Ok quality
customer_reviews.text: Ok quality bite valve looks cheap and fill hole small buy the 3lt has better value and open filler top
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: Good bladder, does what it’s supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it’s supposed to. It holds water, doesn’t leak, and dispenses that water. My only complaint is that it can be tough to get completely dry after cleaning. For context, I’ve taken it into the backcountry for a week at a time, and it’s held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Max Keilson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hydration bladder
customer_reviews.text: Platypus bags are great. The bite valve offers easier access to water, but I've seen several people struggle because of this. Less bite, think more like a straw. Great construction. I got a 3L for my Black Diamond Epic 35 pack, and it's a little too large for the hydration pouch. Still usable by all means though.
customer_reviews.author: timmeh33

customer_reviews.title: Bargain
customer_reviews.text: Lots a lot water for a day in the woods
customer_reviews.author: 3KL

customer_reviews.title: Works great and they have replacement parts that's the best part
customer_reviews.text: Added this to my pack pad for riding in the summer works great
customer_reviews.author: Jsfive

customer_reviews.title: The bags are pretty much indestructible as long as you don't pinch it ...
customer_reviews.text: My old bag lasted 7 years or so and only then sprung a leak due to my own fault. The bags are pretty much indestructible as long as you don't pinch it like I did. Hint: I used Shoo Goo to patch the leaks while I was traveling. I always have a tube with me. I have had to replace the mouth piece once.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Platypus Hoser Hands-Free Hydration System Water Reservoir
product_meta.description: The original Platypus water reservoir that became a backcountry classic, the Platypus Hoser Hands-Free Hydration System Reservoir is an ultralight, minimalist hydration system that delivers taste-free hydration with a versatile, durable design that makes it great for backpacking, thru-hiking, and day hikes. Offered with or without the Fast Flow Valve, the self-sealing HyFLO bite valve delivers a 30-percent increase in flow rate, making it quicker and easier to hydrate on the go. An integrated hang/carry loop makes it easy to secure the reservoir in a backpack or elsewhere. The Hoser is taste-free, BPA-free, BPS-free, phthalate-free and features embedded silver-ion to protect the reservoir from mold and bacteria. The outlet on this versatile reservoir also accepts any threaded Platypus drink tube or closure cap. The Platypus Hoser Reservoir is available in 4 sizes: the 1.0-Liter measures 5.25 x 11.5 inches and weighs 3.2 ounces, the 1.8-Liter measures 7.75 x 11.5 inches and weighs 3.4 ounces, the 2.0-Liter measures 6 x 16 inches and weighs 3.6 ounces, and the 3.0-Liter measures 7 x 16.5 inches and weighs 3.8 ounces. Manufacturer’s limited lifetime warranty. Made in the USA.
feature_bullets: The Hoser comes in four handy sizes to fit practically any hydration pack or replace any hydration reservoir
Taste-free as well as BPA-, BPS-, and phthalate-free hydration reservoir with hanging loop. Embedded silver-ion protects bottle from mold and bacteria.
Hydration hose with lapel clip and Hyperflow bite valve makes it easy to drink on the go. The hydration drink tube is easy to route through the smallest of hydration pack openings.
Food-grade liner with rugged exterior make this hydration bladder clear, pliable and durable
Made in U.S.A. of U.S. and Imported Materials
